intro: Hyalis lorentzii, commonly known as the Lorentz's hyalis, is a perennial flowering plant native to the high altitudes of South America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescences and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in cool, moist conditions. Its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in late spring or early summer. The leaves are finely divided and often have a delicate, fern-like appearance, contributing to its ornamental value.
